title: Gettysburg National Military Park: Park Home
body: A New Birth of Freedom  The Battle of Gettysburg was a turning point in the Civil War, the Union victory that ended General Robert E. Lee's second and most ambitious invasion of the North. Often referred to as the "High Water Mark of the Rebellion", Gettysburg was the Civil War's bloodiest battle and was also the inspiration for President Abraham Lincoln's immortal "Gettysburg Address".              Summer and Fall Ranger Programs   The entire Summer and Fall 2016 Ranger programs schedule can be found here.            Living History Programs   Living History programs at Gettysburg take place every weekend from April-October and include black powder rifle and cannon demonstrations.        Park Social Media Platforms   Stay connected with Gettysburg National Military Park in more ways than ever via all our social media platforms.        Artist in Residence Program   Artists in Residence inspire, engage, and connect with a new generation of artists and visitors.               Start Your Visit Here   Begin your visit at the Gettysburg National Military Park Museum & Visitor Center.        Civil War Timeline   Find out more about how the Battle of Gettysburg fits into the overall Civil War timeline.        Education Planning Tools   Learn all about our ranger field programs, distance learning opportunities, and professional development for Gettysburg.            21st Annual Music Muster   The 21st Annual Gettysburg Music Muster brings together bands and a dance ensemble to help celebrate the music and dance of the Civil War.
